instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, CPU gets hot
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. The version with t2 chip and touchbar.
the Device had some liquid damage. 
The LVDS connector on the Panel looks bad. Already swapped out the Screen, so its new.
It looks like there is no corrosion the logicboard.
L8504 was burnt. Already replaced that, but still no image.
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HTP</SIGNAL> is 3.3V steady after a while.
What could be the cause of this issue? Dead cpu ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, CPU gets hot
threads.message:
Damaged eDP CPU output most likely.
Do you get external video?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, CPU gets hot
threads.message: yes i do have exterenal video

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, CPU gets hot
threads.message:
LCD connector is direrctly connected to CPU; no protection caps in series.
eDP output is dead...
